Class SatSolver

java.lang.Object
SatSolver
public class SatSolver extends Object
The Sat Solver class which provides the core functionality of the Sat4J Solver

    • solver

      private final org.sat4j.specs.ISolver solver
      The SatSolver as Sat4J Object

  • Constructor Details

    • SatSolver

      public SatSolver(int[][] cnf) throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Constructor for the SatSolver class
      Parameters:
      cnf - The rules in the form of a CNF. Example: [[1,2],[-2,3,1]] means: ((1 OR 2) AND (NOT(2) OR 3 OR 1))
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - If the rules are a contradiction. See: Sat4J documentation

    • SatSolver

      public SatSolver()
      Constructor for the SatSolver class without parameters to insert the rules later

  • Method Details

    • isSatisfiable

      public boolean isSatisfiable() throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      Checks if Problem is satisfiable
      Returns:
      is the Problem satisfiable?
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if the calculation takes too much time. See: Sat4J documentation

    • isSatisfiableWith

      public boolean isSatisfiableWith(int var) throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      Check whether there is a model with the given variable.
      Parameters:
      var - Any variable. Variable can be given positively or negatively(-3)
      Returns:
      Is there a Model with the given variable
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if the calculation takes too much time. See: Sat4J documentation

    • isSatisfiableWith

      public boolean isSatisfiableWith(int[] variables) throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      Check whether there is a model with the given variables. Note that these Variables connected by an AND. Example: [1,-2,4] means: is there a model with (1 AND NOT(2) AND 4) is true
      Parameters:
      variables - Any variables. Variables can be given positively or negatively(-3)
      Returns:
      Is there a Model with the given variables
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if the calculation takes too much time. See: Sat4J documentation

    • addVariable

      public void addVariable(int variable) throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Adds a new variable to the rule set. It means, that the given variable should be always true, because the variable is alone in a clause.
      Parameters:
      variable - Any variable. Variable can be given positively or negatively(-3)
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - By adding the variable, the rule set turns into a contradiction. See: Sat4J documentation

    • addRule

      public void addRule(int[] rule) throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Adds a new rule to the rule set. The given rule is a clause and is logically connected by OR's
      Parameters:
      rule - Any rule as a clause. Variables inside the clause can be given positively or negatively [1,-2,4]
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - By adding the rule, the rule set turns into a contradiction. See: Sat4J documentation

    • getModel

      public int[] getModel() throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      Find a model with the rule set.
      Returns:
      The model as int-Array. Each int represents a var. The variables can be positively or negatively. If no exist null will be returned
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if the calculation takes too much time. See: Sat4J documentation

    • getModelWith

      public int[] getModelWith(int[] variables) throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      Finds a Model with the given Variables. Note that these Variables connected by an AND. Example: [1,-2,4] means: is there a model with (1 AND NOT(2) AND 4) is true
      Parameters:
      variables - Any variables. Variables can be given positively or negatively(-3)
      Returns:
      Is there a Model with the given variables. If not null will be returned
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if the calculation takes too much time. See: Sat4J documentation

    • getHighestVar

      public int getHighestVar()
      Provides the highest variable number in the current rule set. If you build the rule set with Variables that only increases by 1 like the rule set contains all variables between 1 and 100, this method will provide the number of variables that exist in the current rule set.
      Returns:
      The highest variable in rule set.
